SetupTraits.Name: Kin
SetupTraits.Description: Imperials are kin, can be bargained with, and will flee or surrender if heavily outnumbered or heavily losing a fight.

ExtraItems.Name: Motivations
ExtraItems.Description: Imperials have orders they are following from whatever guild master, warlord, or under-baron they serve. Usually this is to capture a location, object of power, or person of interest. If characters can work around those orders, Imperials can usually be bargained with or even be helpful.

ExtraItems.Name: Flee
ExtraItems.Description: When the commanding officer of an Imperial detachment is defeated, there's a 1 in 6 chance (roll 1d6) at the start of each round the remaining imperials will attempt to flee or will surrender on the spot, ending the fight.

ExtraItems.Name: Commanding Officer
ExtraItems.Description: Designate one foe the commanding officer of the imperial detachment. They get a special template.
